abstract.para: &suse; offers now new tools with some interesting features to system administrators for online service pack migration. This are simple command line tools, an intuitive graphical user interface, support for rollback of service packs, and some more. This chapter explains how to do a service pack migration step-by-step with the new tools.

sect1.title: Supported Scenarios and Versions
sect1.para: &suse; supports the following scenarios, be it offline or online:

listitem.para: Boot DVD, USB stick, ISO image, &ay;, plain rpm and third-party tools

sect1.title: Service Pack Migration Workflow
sect1.para: A service pack migration can be executed by either &yast;, zypper, &ay;, RPM, or thirt-party tools. Only the first two are described in this chapter. Regardless of the method, a service pack migration consists of the following steps:

The list of migration targets depends on products which you have installed. If you have an extension installed for which the new SP is not yet available, it could be that no migration target is offered to you

The list of migration targets available for your host will always be retrieved from the &scc; and depend on installed products or extensions and may change over time—which mean that, for example, migration from &slea;12 GA to SP2 may be possible for one host, but not possible for another one.

sect1.title: Migrating with &yast; (Online Migration Tool)
sect1.para: In order to perform an service pack migration with &yast;, use the Online Migration tool. By default, &yast; does not install any packages from third-party repository. If a package was installed from a third-party repository, &yast; prevents packages from being replaced with the same package coming from &suse;.

step.para: Install the latest updates to get the Online Migration module.
Install the package yast2-migration and its dependencies.
Restart &yast;, otherwise the new installed module will not be shown in the control center.
Start the Online Migration module from the System section in &yast;.
&yast; will show possible migration targets and a summary.
Select a migration target and proceed with Next.
In case the Online Migration tool offers update repositories, decide if you want them. It is recommended to proceed with Yes.

toms 2015-09-09: FATE#319140 If the Online Migration tool finds obsolete repositories coming from DVD or a local server, it is highly recommended to disable them. Old repositories from &scc; or &smtool; are removed automatically.
Check the summary and proceed with the migration by clicking Next. Confirm with Start Update.
After the successful migration restart your system.

sect1.title: Migrating with Zypper
sect1.para: In order to perform an service pack migration with Zypper, use the command line tool zypper migration.

step.para: Install the packages zypper-migration-plugin and their dependencies.

step.para: By default, Zypper uses the option --no-allow-vendor-change which is passed to zypper dup. If a package was installed from a third-party repository, this option prevents packages from being replaced with the same package coming from &suse;.
